page.title: 01Ufton,Warwickshire and Area.
page.content: This area is mainly farmland with the small village of {UFTON} almost in the centre.The tiny community of {BASCOTE HEATH} is at its eastern edge.{UFTON} stands on an escarpment which runs from the south west to the north east & divides the 12 sq.km. in half.There are 13 farms in the area.Land use is either grazing or arable farming.The main crop is cereals.Some sheep & dairy cattle are kept.Amenities include 2 public houses,a shop/post office & the village hall.There is a church & a small chapel. The main A425 road runs north west to south east from {LEAMINGTON SPA} to {SOUTHAM} while the B4452 links {BASCOTE HEATH} with nearby {HARBURY}. Other features include about 200 acres of private woodland & 77 acres of NATURE RESERVE.
